snippet: A good narrator, in books and in life, is the guide who makes sense of the story. So why have so many storytellers given up on narration?
abstract: Steve Almond Riff essay emphasizes importance of good narrator, and questions why so many modern storytellers have seemingly given up on creating effective ones.
lead_paragraph: A good narrator, in books and in life, is the guide who makes sense of the story. So why have so many storytellers given up on narration?
